conbody.p: The launch configuration defines the configuration used by the Eucalyptus instances used for auto scaling. This includes the image name, the instance type, key pairs, security groups, and block device mappings. You associate the launch configuration to an auto scaling group. Each auto scaling group can have one (and only one) associated launch configuration.

Once you've created a launch configuration, you can't change it; you must create a new launch configuration group and then associate it with an auto scaling group. Once you've created and attached a new launch configuration to an auto scaling group, any new instances will be launched using parameters defined in the new launch configuration; existing instances in the auto scaling group are not affected.
